title: Riven's ideals and "the pure noxian vision" ?
body:
Riven's old lore mentioned her being "on a quest to seek atonement and a way to save the pure Noxian vision in which she believed". A Rioter also mentioned in a thread from about a year ago that Riven still represents "the best of what Noxus is and could be". https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/6JWHilrN-rivens-faction-should-be-ionia-now?comment=0003
As far as I know, Noxus always had this "might makes right" mentality, it's why they have been trying to expand their borders since the inception of their empire and even noxian society itself follows social darwinist and meritocratic principles. Anyone who is strong and skilled enough can simply work their way up. Riven today however seems to have an entirely different set of values, with quotes like "So much death.", "A necessary strike." and "Violence to end violence." implying that her ultimate goal is peace rather than the vision of might and glory that Noxus represents. Her quote "My hands are stained." also implies that she regrets her service to Noxus rather than "just" disapproving of the chemical warfare they employed (which was NOT her fault and therefore couldn't have "stained" her hands).
So does this change in her lore imply that there is no "pure noxian vision" that she would support and that she severed her connection to the ideals of Noxus? And if not, what kind of "noxian vision" would she support?

replies.body:
I think Riven discovered Noxus wasn't really a meritocracy.   What it professes to be and believe in and its behavior don't always line up. 

Believing in strength and merit based advancement has to be _balanced_ (hint) with a level playing field and honorable conduct.
I think a lot of people think, "Noxus is a utopia that has achieved equality of opportunity.”, but I feel relieved that if Riot doesn't necessarily think so.

I think there's a lot of plot potential in exploring the lies within the Noxian dream. A few questions that immediately arise from looking at the faction:

1. Swain claims the empire is a melting pot of cultures where diversity is cherished -  yet Noxus doesn't really _look_ like a functioning multicultural society. The enormous capital in particular has only one aesthetic, that is the uniform triangular machismo we are used to associating with Swain and Darius. If all these creeds and culture coexist, why aren't they allowed to express it in the city's architecture and presentation?

2. Speaking of the Trifarix, Noxus takes immense pride in weaponizing magic, and yet **there is no mage scholar on the Trifarix **- indeed, there are no mage scholars in power anywhere in Noxus. (Swain has no academic knowledge of magic, Darius, well... and Faceless might be a puppet on strings as far as the people who do the heavy arcane lifting are concerned). Are mages oppressed in Noxus too? The lack of political representation certainly points that way.

3. Women on the Trifarix/Occupying important positions of power? Even Putin's Russia has more women in important roles.

It kind of looks like Swain is making some big promises and not working very hard to keep them. The slogan-y, propaganda-y manner of speaking and presentation on his side, combined with the obvious Surveillance Ravens speaks to the possibility that the Demon of Secrets might be keeping a bit too many...
Noxus isn't a real country and their politics shouldn't be anything close to ours. Stop making comparisons with fiction and irl.

Is the part of Riven's background story where she despised Noxus for using Zaun's weapons rather than dying to the superior tactics of the Ionians still canon? 
Everyone seems to forget that is rather explicitly stated, since the League Judgment written at her release and even in her more recent lore, the actual reason she defected. Not because they genocided their own troops.

I'm not sure why Riven's voiceover is completely contradictory to the lore she was originally written with and I haven't read any lore since the Jinx story that came out around Universe's launch so if her modern lore fits her VO better, then I stand corrected.

It's just a guess, but Any Noxian can participate in the war as a soldier for the country, and if they give the same result, they will receive the same evaluation, but could a from lower class soldier like her have achieved results without the inhumane measures she hated?
Kayn was also a talented child, but he was sacrificial pawn.
Would they have been treated like this if they had been born aristocrats?

>
>lower class soldier like her

Ah yes, General Riven, leader of the regiment that was storming a small Ionian village. The same Riven who ordered her troops to behead a crying teenage girl and who gave the orders that directly resulted in the ambush that lead to the launch of the Zaunite war machine's poison gas. 
That Riven, right?

The same Riven that is considered a prodigy and was granted a magic sword as a badge and symbol of the glory and strength she brought Noxus? 

*THAT* Riven? 
Low class soldier my ass. Unless anyone below Darius and Swain is 'low class' I guess.
It was stated by a rioter that the events in the Awaken music video are actual written stories. Is there a chance we could get Riven's story anytime soon?
Does this mean she would be okay with Noxus violently expanding its borders as long as it doesn't employ any "dirty" tactics? Because to me it seems like that would contradict her in-game quotes.
...Is Riven going to launch a fucking counter invasion.

Not sure what the Rioters are on about. As of her 3-part short story (Confessions of a Broken Blade), she's adopted by an Ionian couple and wants to build a new life for herself in Ionia. There'd be no way she'd leave the people that adopted her as family, and promised the judge she'd live to rebuild Ionia.

Heck, Kayn is listed as an Ionian. As of her latest lore, I don't think Riven wants *any* part of Noxus anymore and seems to like her new life of helping build rather than destroy, though she'll still gut someone if they threaten those she loves.

As of now, as far as I'm concerned, Riven's 110% an Ionian, and about as goody goody as they come.

She helps the regeneration of Ionia, but it is meaningless if destroyed again by Noxus.
To do that she needs to change Noxus.
Isn't her ideal Noxian principle common good?
I think this applies not only between Noxus and Ionia, but also inside Noxus.
Riven is a Noxian and a Ionian daughter, That's not contradictory.
I think there are things that only she can do.

Riven viewed the true Noxian way as honor and glory through power and combat.  Proving ones skill and strength through hard work and determination was her way of life, and what she tried to share with her men.  However the chemical bombing that Swain authorized Singed to perform on the battlefield was a total opposite of what she held as her core beliefs.  Hence why she regrets her actions, in her new perspective the true honor and Noxian way is lost to a Noxus under Swain.  A Noxus that sacrifices both her men and the enemy forces through chemical warfare is cowardly and vile to her.  Consider that as well she lost all of her unit before her eyes, as well most likely in quite the ugly fashion and then you have the makings of some serious self hating and regret. 

I wouldn't say she regrets her service to Noxus, she clearly still loves her homeland, but at the same time she has some misgivings about it's current leadership and the part she unknowingly played into their power struggles.   As well she's been living integrated with the Ionans for a while and has learned other ways to view life in her self imposed exile.  I imagine that her world view has shifted quite a bit since then and could have affected her vision of "the ideal Noxus."
In the rewritten lore Swain seized power only after the Ionian war so Riven didn't even know him nor does she know about Noxus' current ideals
Ok, I'm not up to date fully on the rewritten lore I guess.

This is pretty much what I think she'd be if she didn't explicitly condemn killing and violence that isn't directed at ending killing and violence. Even a war that is fought with "honorable", "fair" and "clean" methods is still merely the application of violence and systematic killing to achieve whatever it is they want to achieve, wether it is honor, glory, power or something else. Glory for one's homeland is a very partisan ideal, but Riven herself says that she does what she does "for the greater good". If this "greater good" was merely the glory of her homeland, then she might as well just say "for noxus" or "the glory of noxus". For this reason I think she abandoned her partisan way of thinking.
